Please review :smile:

title: Polish translation
Add a Gitter chat badge to README.md
body:
### airbnb/javascript now has a Chat Room on Gitter

@hshoff has just created a chat room. You can visit it here: [https://gitter.im/airbnb/javascript](https://gitter.im/airbnb/javascript?utm_source=badge&utm_medium=badge&utm_campaign=pr-badge&content=body_link).

This pull-request adds this badge to your README.md:

[![Gitter](https://badges.gitter.im/Join Chat.svg)](https://gitter.im/airbnb/javascript?utm_source=badge&utm_medium=badge&utm_campaign=pr-badge&utm_content=body_badge)

Happy chatting.

PS: [Click here](https://gitter.im/settings/badger/opt-out) if you would prefer not to receive automatic pull-requests from Gitter in future.

title: It's ok to use those linters for Node?
body:
Hello, 

So I want to use this on my sails application, but not completely sure if all those rules are good to use on back-end (node).

Regards,

title: Update 'Performance' section of README.md.
body: Update 'Performance' section of README.md to point to the most recent revisions of each test.

title: Included Weggo as one of the companies actively using this style guide
Please add Target to the list of users in the wild
body:
We have recently adopted this style guide with the intention of using it and growing it for our JS practice, and would love to be part of the list of fellow users in the wild. Our fork is available here: 

https://github.com/target/javascript

I could send a PR instead, but I didn't want to make someone cherrypick specific lines as we start to modify the guide. If you'd prefer I'd do that anyway, let me know.

title: Opinion on formatting if else if else block?
Missing semicolon
body: Added missing semicolon.

title: Always use braces
body: I'm OK with saying that people _can_ omit braces in a unique particular instance if they want, but, I am extremely uncomfortable dictating that they _must not_ use braces in some subjective instances. I find it an acceptable evil to ommit braces in some cases if you _really want_, but, would rather the consistency of just saying "always use braces".

title: Updates and Adds external links to javascript#semicolon
body: There are two changes: first, the ambiguous text of an external link was made more meaningful; second, an external link was added to provide readers more information about semicolon usage.
